reviews.review_msg: The single worst class I have ever taken at SFU bar none. Useless lectures, brutal assignments, midterms and final. Most had ambiguous questions and he was not flexible with marking. I did a co-op at a data analytics company and can tell he has no idea what is going on. Though my end grade was good it was achieved 99% as a result of self learning.

Overall not bad. His lectures are terrible and he knows it. He assigns a project that is very good to put on your resume, although very time consuming and tedious. Go to him in office hours if you have questions; he's actually good at explaining things in office.. He curves generously. Got a great mark in this class by only reading slides.

Biggest nightmare in my academic career. I studied everynight for this course still only able to pull a C+. useless lecture. horrible assignments. midterm and final had nothing to do with textbook and assignment. If you want to have a horrible semester take his classes , you will definitely enjoy that semester!

Terrible lectures. Assignments are impractical and have nothing to do with what is expected on tests. Lecture material is abstract; he seems to be unable to clarify many things. Many test questions asked have nothing to do with the textbook. Attendance is definitely mandatory. Better off waiting to take it with Oliver Schulte.

The person who said that his notes are "HORRID" obviously didn't realize that they were straight from the textbook lol... almost word for word. His notes follow the textbook sequentially so the material is easy to follow. He isn't much of a lecturer but the material speaks for itself and he gives you everything you NEED to know.

I'm halfway into the semester, and I had to post this. His notes are HORRID. I do NOT know what he is talking about. His notes are absolutely confusing. They talk about stuff and assume you know terms. No order. Topics are incredibly vague. PLEASE do not take him. For your learning's sake.
Doesn't know how to program his assignments nor even show simple SQL commands.  Not sure why he is teaching it and basically learned everything on my own.
The most useless professor I've ever had. Do not attend his class, he will only confuse you more. Read his slides, the textbook, wikipedia, etc and teach yourself. Exams are average.

I don't why people underrate this professor. He is one of the best profs I ever had. Lecture slides are extremely useful, and he always willing to help the students. At first you may find it difficult to follow him, but eventually you will get to used to his teaching.Exams are not that hard if you fully understand the content of lecture slides.

Terrible professor, his notes are worthless since you can't understand half of it and not all the material is from the text book, you should also study some links provided in his slides along with the reference book. His class is boring and useless, he basically reads from his slides and everyone's sleep during his class.final exam was super hard.

Horrible.  One of the worst professors I've had at SFU yet.  Doesn't know his own material, is incredibly unclear, uses transparencies of his own slides and doesn't know what they say, assignments unrelated to his material, and tests even more unclear than that.  Avoid at all cost.

one of horrible teacher i have met. his lecture is horrible. he doesnt have teaching skill. the lecture slides are from main notes but still so bad. learn NOTHING from him. Horrible organization with everything related to this course.
Professors like him make the CS department weak.  Even if I pass this course, I am going to consider retaking it with a better professor.
no
okay professor.  assignments/exams are quite challenging, so work hard, but u can still do well if u study off the prof.'s notes (don't need the book actually)
I am taking his course this semester. He was a great prof. Some people told me his english was poor, but I didn't find that true at all. Very helpful and clear.

the assignment doesn't make any sense coz his english is so horrible... midterm is the same... final is the same... what more to say? I don't know how he manage to stay in SFU with his english, even the TA has no idea what the prof wants :)
Very disorganized and the wording on his assignments and exams is brutal. His lectures are extremely boring and unhelpful. Not recommended.

I hope he reads these postings and TAKES A HINT. English: Horrible, Teaching: Horrible, Notes: Copied from the main notes - yet still had errors. I learned NOTHING about SQL because he didn't show us anything more than queries. Horrible organization with midterm, and next to ZERO people skills.
He can't teach, bad english. I understand Martin Yan's english in food network much better than his english. Very difficult final exam! Not recommended.
dont read mine. Read other comments on this proff. I'd rather fail this one and pick another proff next time. I learnt nothing. This could be useful you know?

Professor does not speak or understand English whether it be verbal or written.  Assignments are not useful from a theoretical or practical standpoint.  His lectures are a huge waste of time, and the midterm is irrelevant.

The worst prof i have ever had. Please don't take him, you will just waste your money. Even if you somehow manage to get a decent grade, you'll have learned nothing. His assignments are long and boring. Midterm is hard and doesn't make any sense. His english is just terrible. Definate NONO, again NO
horrible teaching. hard midterm, not enough time to finish it. internets, his english is poor on top of being a bad lecturer. not recommended

His midterm was challenging but I found there was enough time to do it. The final was the same way. I much preferred his low level approach to databases rather than the "SQL for dummies" that CMPT 354 usually ends up being.

His english is poor and his lectures are boring. There were ONLY 6 out of 20 students went to his lecture.  He has no organization on notes. No practical assignments (no SQL setup and triggers). No body has enough time to finish the midterm.
He listens to student feedback and strives to improve his course components when necessary, this is rare among SFU profs.

Goated prof. Practical assignments, covers needed information in lectures, fair final (mt was a bit rushed for time). Would take again. Make sure to pay attention in class as he sometimes mentions what to focus on for exams! : )

Super likeable ! Good lecturer, clear assignments, and fair midterm+exam! Sometimes notes have minor mistakes but otherwise notes are really useful even without going to lecture (but you should go anyway! Answers to questions on notes are not in the notes). Mild accent but you get used to it after about 2 lectures, don't worry.

Took CMPT 354 with him and he approached the class in a way few other professors did. He taught us the skills and nuances in a way to prepare us to actually use those skills in the future and extend our knowledge of databases and data architecture. Of course the course itself was relatively simple but his enthusiasm helped keep interest.

Jiannan's first time teaching an undergraduate class, CMPT 354, was a breath of fresh air as he takes modern approaches to the course material and concepts. What you learn is straightforward and is applicable to the work industry. Assignments and midterm are easy as long you pay attention to class and follow along. Would highly recommend him!

His lectures are easy to follow along with. He is very approachable and will spend time to answer any questions you might have. He is also caring and understanding towards his students. We were allowed 4 grace days for assignments spread over the term. Would take another course with him if I could.

Unorganized and unprepared.. Often.. He is very knowledgeable and cares, and is a nice person, but can spend so much time off topic that I forget what he was teaching. Often breaks and changes topic mid sentence and can be difficult to follow. Assignments were very easy and small then suddenly ABSURDLY large and difficult at the end.

I was a bit apprehensive with his lecture at first because he doesn't really do demos, only writing them on his iPad. However, he is really accessible if you have any questions. His grading criteria are clear. You also get to have a cheat sheet for all exams. Lastly, I really like that he connects the course content with his industry experience.

He always goes above and beyond basic teaching requirements. His assignments are very meticulously designed to help students learn the material the best way possible. He also makes use of his industry experiences in teaching which is both practical and refreshing.

Dr. Pei gives a clear understanding of what each exam will look like, including topics for each question, so preparing is straightforward. He also did several check-ups on students throughout the term to adjust the difficulty of the class and sent us off with a heart-warming email at the end. Simply one of the best profs in the CMPT department.

Professor Pei is one of the most caring profs I've ever had - he extended the deadline for an assignment and pushed one midterm back a week to make sure we were all good with the material. His lectures can be kind of long, but his assignments are great for applying concepts and his midterms were very fair.

Go look at Pei's website and then be in amazed at his list of accomplishments. Now be happy because not only does he have the expertise, he is also a great prof. Fair assignments, and then more than fair exams that are based off of those assignments. Also great for asking questions and having additional office hours. Do attend class though.
Extended the deadline for Assignment 2 two times. Automatic 5/5. KEKW

Professor Pei is a fair professor for CMPT 354. His lectures and slides are dense with information, and occasionally he would forget to update them prior to class. Lectures do drag on for a while, especially in the 2 hour lectures. However, there are tons of useful content in his slides and his assignments are great for applying in-class topics!

Well, I did not put too much effort at all into that course so did not end up with a good grade. Totally personal reason and I don't blame the prof at all. My classmates seem to enjoy his lectures and he seems to be a reasonable grader.

easy class in terms of content. project for 15% is bs since it's just using tablets to show HP that he's actually doing something with them (learning nothing db oriented) and too much work for 15%. overall easy exams and assignment marking resulting in high average of class and 80% being a B-.

Lots of material and workload, but worthwhile learning. Understandable lecs although his English is fluent but problematic. Somewhat challenging asns, but eventually doable. TA is a nice marker. Major pbms are the 15% semesterlong project (tedious data cleaning and programming) and the bell curve which actually lowers grades of many students.
average as an instructor
Nice teacher, really knows what he teahches. 3 assignments in total and one group project. Easy midterm and final.
Nice, competent prof. Lectures not engaging and too connected to slides. Follow the class and put the required time into the project and you'll do fine. Recommended.
Very good prof, fair and knows how to teach :)

Agree with the disappointed comment.  He is a very nice person and very enthusiastic, but very horrible course notes.  His marking on projects are very sloppy just like his project descriptions.  He enjoys torturing students to teach them a taste of real life .. fun :P

Super easy.  Class average is currently around 95%... what this means for final grades we'll see.  Interesting project and decent lectures.  He is clear and seems to understand what to say to convey the material clearly and efficiently.

I read about all the good words here about him before taking this course. However, short after the semestre began I started to doubt if this was the person as described by others. He is a nice softie, but stubborn. Loose requirements on projects led to lousy marking confilicts. Being not so stardardized is the biggest problem.

His class is him just readiing his mistake ridden slides. 

Additionally, there is a noticeable inconsistency in the grading criteria, which undergoes frequent changes on a weekly basis. 

Moreover, his teaching abilities are wanting, marked by challenges in both the articulation of the English language and logical comprehension
lack of enough knowledge and a low-level and disrespectful personality in interactions.

Super nice and well organized. Always happy to help students by all means. Assignments were relevant to the course material. The course was offered online and he handled it well. Exams were very fair and he did not seem to be tough grader. I do recommend him for this course

OMG! this prof screwed the grades at the end of the semester. obviously, people getting A,A+ would say good things but I am really disappointed that in a cmpt course at 87% I got B. and explain me how is this a higher grade for my hard work? this means people who get in range of A are the respectable ones only.

The course was well organized by Prof. Tayebi and we got good feedback from the assignments which really helped us in the group project. The final was a bit scuffed but everything else I think was well done. He is easily accessible through Piazza and will answer most if not all questions in a timely manor. Would recommend.

I understand sql stuff are relatively easy to teach in CS, but still, he's one of the best CMPT professor I've had so far. He is extremely organized and the amount of resources he gives is really appreciated. His TA management is great as well. He can sometimes be a little hard to understand, but overall I've had an amazing experience in this class

Had lots of learning resources that helped me learn/practice concepts (lectures, tutorials, mentorships, practicals, Ripple, Piazza) but only Ripple questions were for marks/mandatory. Homework and exam were exactly what I expected but obviously harder than usual but still doable. I recommend doing the practicals, they really help

His lectures are good but he is really a tough grader if the class average is high. I dont mind whatever grade scheme is being used in his class but he should specify in the starting that he is going to screw your GPA with his own decided grade scheme. I am really disappointed at the end of the semester and I am sad that I took my classes with him

Solid lecture notes, lectures themselves can run late sometimes but content is good. Semester projects and homework assignments were solid and helped you apply material learned in class well. Easy to reach and get feedback outside of class, and was flexible in adjusting assignments/projects according to student feedback. Solid prof, would take.

Bobby gives easy marks on assignment, however his exam are difficult as usual. It is a norm that his class avg for exams are barely passing or fail, just work hard on the assignments, and it should be an easy B.
Bobby gives tough exams but assignments we're graded that harshly. Lectures were pretty decent because he always spends enough time answering questions. Office hours at 830 am are negative.
Concepts are vague exam questions are vague assignments are vague

I don't know why he make every class he teaches more difficult than other teachers. And many knowledges he teaches are also unfamiliar to him. For midterm, 35min for 25 questions? Or 35min for 32 questions? Don't choose him except one level class.

Never take a class with bobby Chan. He makes any course extra hard for no reason. His exams were 40 questions in 35 minutes even though our lecture was 50 minutes long. He even cancels office hours and issues weekly assignments that feel like projects. Also its been months and our midterm isnt even marked yet. Avoid avoid avoid
Highly recommended, he is very kind and helpful, he explains material very clearly.  Exams were hard, you really need to know the material well.
I find it very confusing when he makes up his own terminology and never explains what he means by it

Dr. Miao is very generous with both his grading scheme and giving tons of part marks. Exams are open book meaning your grade comes down to how well you are familiar with the material. Homework assignment do take a lot of time to complete. I found it difficult to understand Dr. Miao in lecture but his slides are very straightforwards.
assignments are heavy but fun. there's one coding assignment, no project.

Not sure why my review was taken down but Mr. Miao is a great professor and tries very hard. He cares a lot about his students and wants you to do well. Very kind grading scheme and high class average. Would highly recommend.

He clearly wants his students to do well and had a very kind grading scheme. Reasonable number of assignments and usually provided a program to check your answers for correctness. Recorded audio lectures. 3 midterms but dropped your worst. No final. Would definitely recommend!

Not sure why SFU decided to let him teach an upper division course, because we learned nothing from him. His lecture is from other professor, and it is extremely difficult to understand what he is saying in the lecture. I feel like all of the knowledge I got from this course is from self-learning.
The first assignment was unnecessarily difficult, after that they are doable and you actually learn something from them. The midterms are open book and difficult.

He seems to be a nice guy but is completely out of touch with his students. He has taken the complexity of all topics to the extreme and I feel as though my foundation of SQL is poor as difficulty went from 0-100 instantly. The first assignment we had to learn complex syntax that is completely useless as it is not used anywhere in the real world.

She is the best professor of Computing Science department. I can bet on that. Her lecture notes are amazing. She explains everything in detail. She is so good in the basics and concepts. CMPT 354 with her was worth taken and the project made you learn the entire DBMS. She is good in the gradings too. Take any course with her without blinking.

Really good professor!!!
Pace is easy to catch.
Sufficient practise for quiz and homework.
Textbook is not mandatory, lecture slides are very clear, detailed and cover everything.
Group project in 3 people group, through the beginning to the end of the term, every milestone of the project is associated to what you are learning that time.

Hazra clearly cares about her students' learning. The lectures had a good balance of involving students in discussion and explaining concepts. Always willing to take questions as well. Lecture recordings were also made available and class was streamed over zoom for students who could not make it in.

Very clear and well put together lectures. I learned a lot in this class, everything was presented in a way that was easy to understand. There is one group project where you work in teams of 3 to implement a database system from start to finish. Lecture recordings and slides/notes were made available which was useful for review.

She is one of the very few professors left in computer science departments who actually teach the course and dont tell you to go learn it yourself. She explains everything clearly and course-load isnt heavy. Also it's easy to understand her accent. When she starts the lecture, its hard not to concentrate. I would recommend taking her in the future

Not surprisingly, one of the best instructors in CPSC department. Learning goals are clearly laid out, lectures are clear and a lot of opportunities to learn the materials through clickers and in-class activities. Her exams ... quite fair. Would recommend to take database courses with her.

It's easy to follow lectures but sometimes handwriting gets a bit messy. Lectures recorded, post lecture notes posted, iclickers in class, and tests are fair(like assignment/lecture examples) Tests are a bit time constrained, but you should have enough time to read and process the question, just don't get stuck for > 5 min for multiple questions.

She is flexible and easy to talk to which is great. The course material is fair, though her exams are a bit challenging due to time management. She posts all her notes online, as well as lecture recordings - very convenient if you have life/work commitments. She does not curve - put the effort into the project/work and you will get a good mark.
Attend the lectures and learn what he teaches in the lectures, and you'll do just fine.
He knows the material well and does a good job of teaching it. He was using some of the material from the online Stanford course which I thought was clever. Totally recommend taking 354 with him.
you will feel confidence in databases at the end.
Good instructor and fair mareker.
If you follow the instruction well, it's easy to get an A+!
Good prof, knows the material well and extremely fair marker.
He is a bit old, which means lectures can often be a bit slow. However, he does pay a lot of attention to details, and tries to answer interesting questions students have in class.
he gave me A+  so hes my king

Lecture slides explain things badly and he just reads off of them the whole time. Assignment guidelines, sample outputs, and due dates also keep getting changed, requiring re-submissions. Midterm questions were printed weird so it was hard to find where the multiple choice answers actually were. Everything is disorganized, and wastes your time.
shows up to office hours late and ends them early. in class he just reads off slides.
final median 55 and he did not curved
To the people commented below, exam is tomorrow. How do you know your letter grade already?

Avoid him , he's a master of jargons... He might be a "nice" guy, but at this age he's not good as prof. He can't explain materials clearly, lecture notes are full of jargons ... John edgar is your only good prof for cmpt 354

Very nice guy. Sometimes could be a little more clear on lectures but he knows what he is talking about and is happy to answer questions. I got the sense he wanted more class participation. Also some of his slides use kind of outdated SQL practices but he is fairly lenient on tests so it's fine.

to be honest, at this age he shouldn't teach anymore. I can't even understand what he's saying in lectures, mostly due to his age and accent. He's mostly read from lecture slides, and very useless lectures. I have to copy each of his slides to chatgpt to explain me what exactly this prof is saying. Avoid him, not much I learned from this course...

Genuinely just not a great professor. There was homework every single week of the semester, each time, new homework was released the day before the previous was due. Just feels like poor care for the students.

I asked him to put complete lecture slides on the canvas page and he refused stating that students must come to class. Exams are 8/10 hard.

Dr Ester is the best professor I have ever seen. He respects every student in his class. And he is willing to give students partial marks even the answer is not correct. His lecture is boring but the exam is very fair, everything is from either slides or assignments. I would take more database topic courses with him.
SOOOOOOO BORING, he is smart and know everything but just not good at teaching, bad lecture bad slices, I stopped attending the lecture after midterm, just learn by yourself to get an easy A

Good prof. Very willing to help and takes student feedback into account. Posts very detailed notes online. Assignments (weekly) range from easy to fair. Exams are open book. Tough midterm (too long!), okay final. Classes always go overtime. Contrary to what others have said, I *would* take another class with him.

If you learn well from the textbook, you will do OK. His assignments and exams are fair, but his teaching is quite bad. It's unfortunate too because he's a nice guy and wants everyone to do well. And yes, he goes over time every lecture so don't take a class right after his class.

Exams are extremely long. Don't expect to finish in time. Beware of keeners in the class. They tend to get him off track for a very long time. Our review class, which was suppose to REVIEW the semester.. ended up only covering 3 questions in 1 section.. IN TWO DAYS. Thanks WM, black coat, squeaky kid, durrr kid. You know who you are.

Horrible prof ever. I am ready to quit his lecture and wait another year for someone else. Lectures extremely boring, midterm & final - never enough time to complete, assignments easy but not enough percentage on total marks. Marking schemes never fair!! Please take my advise and avoid him.

Nice guy, lectures are boring, exams open-book, assignment grades nice, but midterm fatal. listening to him is like trying to understand ****. It shouldnt be too hard to get a good grade in his class though.

Smart guy BUT, useless when it comes to teaching. Fortunatly the material is easy and the assignments aren't too bad. However, DON'T expect to learn ANYTHING from him. His notes are often incorrect so don't follow them. Oh yeah, test, can't judge the amount of time you need to write a test so you are often trying to write a 2 hour midterm in 1 hour

Knows what he is talking about, but have trouble (at certain times) in teaching it. Hands out alot of assign. but are relatively easy to do. Midterm and final exam are reasonable, but really has a tough time judging amount of time required to finish it. Overall, a decent prof that knows his stuff.

Most boring prof EVER, he also has attitude problem.
 But his assns and exams are pretty easy
He sucks, can't teach
Unreasonably long midterm for 50 min. Reasonable final with open book, expect a lots of writing though. WILL definitely take him for 454.
No so good at explaining. Lectures are boring. Open book exam. I wouldn't take another class with him.
Easy assignment and exam, but he can't teach
OPEN BOOK exam, reasonable assign, knowledgeable!!
Very average prof. Not great but also not bad at teaching. Assignments were straightforward but hard to get full marks on. Exams were reasonable difficulty.

Terrible experience, all his lecture slides had errors , his quizzes also had errors. His lectures were incredibly dry and he had the audacity to never teach us how to get FDs out of a set of statement and then test us on it in the final. Changed the final questions 3 times during the final and then refused to give extra time. He makes 210k btw

It was TOO DRY! I think the teaching method is also outdated. I did not enjoy this class with him. He is caring and a very nice person. However, the way he teaches just makes the course so boring. Assignments are hard, and I believe he does not go over examples, he just teaches simple things and expects us to learn!
He is good at explaining concepts, and he is fair. His assignments are not that easy, but they help a lot with midterms and final exams. I will take more classes with him in the future.
Caring for students and giving them a very comfortable way to take the final exam under SFU's ridiculous final exam rescheduling time and time again.

He is best prof I had so far at SFU. His teaching is crystal. He always encourages audience raise questions and always answered them. As the result, the whole class is so much engaged. Advice: please attend lectures, do the exercise he asked.
WHAT A SHAME! She copied everything from an equivalent course in UBC CPSC304!! EXACTLY SAME FINAL EXAM QUESTIONS! SAME TYPOS!!
Not a very good instructor, but the class is easy and you can self-study. Her marking is too nitpicky for my liking. I wouldn't recommend.

Jane is even worse in 354 than 125. Relational databases and mySQL should be taught by native or near-native English speakers. Her expectations are unclear but her marking is diabolical. The textbook is an easy read. I agree that Langara CS faculty are better; I honestly think FAS cares more about number of publications than English proficiency.

1-All the people giving bad reviews are ina  first year compsci course. Guys computer science is hard you have to learn how to manage these university classes. 2-Yes she has an accent but I did not struggle in understanding her I think major exaggeration is being shown I had her for 354 and gave her an ok review cant write more

other then not learning much, the last assignment - 3&4 grades came less then 3 days before the final and the 3rd midterm came after the final was released. expect no feedback and no responses for your questions other then a yes or no if using online discussions with her
Didn't learn too much, but the prof was nice and the grading was nice.
I got an A but I don't really understand databases to the degree that I should. What is even normalization?
Best prof 2018

For Apala to receive so many bad reviews in only 4 months should be a big red flag for you. She puts minimal effort into her videos and in person lectures. Wastes 10 minutes going over material covered in online lectures. The unfortunate 80 people cant get our 4 months back, but we can help everyone else to avoid tanking their gpa and wasting time

Horrible online lectures that do not teach you what you need to know for assignments/tests. Horrible marking scheme for assignments, either get 15/15 on a problem or 0/15, even if code for the assignment was not entirely incorrect. Takes far too long to mark everything. Had to self learn everything in this course.
Take CMPT354 from her if you enjoy challenges.
BEST PROF EVEEEE
Skip the classes, study at home.

The grading criteria and rubrics for assignments were unclear and the grades were released too late so while I thought I was doing well at the assignments, my grades were terrible eventually and I could do nothing to improve them because a couple of days before the 3rd assignment deadline came, the 1st assignment grades were just released.

While her online lectures are an improvement over actually going to class in the first place, even those are slow and hard to concentrate on. In class, a time for review on material covered.. .in the online lects? She "listens" to students ask questions and then responds by talking about something different, and passes it to other students to answr

She is a professor with a really good knowledge of compiler design for CMPT 379, but she just doesn't have the background knowledge and experience for Databases, so that explains why she cannot teach the course well. If you have no choice but to take her class, it is possible to pass and end up with a decent grade, but don't expect to learn much.

An absolutely frustrating experience. Consistently late, answered students' questions with questions. In person lectures seemed unorganized, and she often ended early. The assignments lacked clarity. Video lectures were of poor quality. Asked for feedback and then blamed the students. Overall, just truly unprofessional.
Great prof :)

Video lectures were a great idea, if she did them properly. They were difficult to understand, and jumped all over the place. Any questions directed at her in class she would redirect them back to the class for another student to answer. Assignments were ambiguous and hard to follow with no examples. Please avoid.

Do not take CMPT354 with her, I REPEAT, DO NOT. You pretty much learn nothing from her. You will be better off just read and learn SQL by yourself on Tutorialpoints. or other online resources. Even though the exams are seemingly easy but the instructions and questions are usually confusing and not clear. Definitely avoid.
Confusing, unstructured lectures and assignments. Many questions are unclear and left for your to interpret as she does clearly state criteria. Answers your questions with questions.
She taught us literally nothing with those 10 minutes "video lectures". I feel like I am better dumping my tuition into the toilet than taking another course with her..

She has terrible "lecture videos" that is supposed to be your lecture notes. Out of 3 lectures per week, she hosted only 2 and skipped at least 3 lectures on top of ending the lecture early occasionally because "she has nothing else to say". Exams aren't difficult but the pure lack of content to study or learn from made writing exams hard.

A very Incompetent teacher. Asked the classroom after the mid-term if they had any issues regarding the exam. Numerous students mentioned valid claims to issues with the midterm. Every single time there was any form of criticism she would immediately blame the student. Assignments and exams were all over the place in terms of information &structure

Took this class at the start of the Pandemic. The prof went from not the greatest to the worst prof ive ever had. When classes switched to online she gave us a 15 min video per week instead of online classes. She deducted marks from people for asking questions about her poor wording. She refused to answer her email and refused to accommodate anyone

- gets mad at students for writing quiz at home during a pandemic (code quiz code from friend who attended class) - docks marks for not informing her of who your group partner is by email IN ADDITION to Canvas - threatens to dock marks for asking questions about the project This seems to be the underlying attitude of this prof. Avoid!

During 354, Dr. Karimi has threatened to dock marks for asking questions, dock marks for choosing to do a group project individually, for not attending class during a pandemic, and given inadequate instruction and support. Her apathetic attitude is not only disrespectful to her students, but also to her colleagues, and the name of the university.

I took 371 with her last year. She hasn't improved one bit. When you ask a question, her answer is mostly useless and leaves you more confused. The class is almost always half-empty because her lectures are boring, uninspired, and sometimes don't cover things in the homework assignment. I wish I could say more. A nice lady but a horrible teacher.

It was not an exciting learning environment. Sometimes she seems just as confused as you are and does not give the best explanation/ illustration for important topics that you need to know from front to back.
TA is unhelpful, teaching insufficient.
My biggest regret in Ouldooz's 354, other than enrolling, is that I did not skip every single one of her class and just read the textbook instead. I would have learnt much more.
Quiz expects you to memorize meaningless details of the history of SQL; She does not write examples on board, so she struggles to make students understand even the simplest concept like a Join.

Homework and exam difficulty are on the easier side compared to other CMPT courses. She is very nice but her lectures are very boring. Her notes are decent but you will need to google stuff if you want a deeper understanding of certain concepts.

Ouldooz did a good job teaching for the first time. Assignment criteria was unclear at first, but she did her best to clear things up. Lectures weren't the best due to her accent and she frequently mixed up words or had spelling errors in her slides. Overall, she did her best and she definitely has potential to be a better prof in the future.
Easy courses. Some assignments criteria were unclear at first. Is a fair and caring instructor though.
Not a bad prof. Tries to teach but not good yet. I can definitly see some good potential in her

If you ever think that a professor is terrible, well you haven't seen this one yet. She one of a kind. Terrible lectures, give unreasonably difficult assignments, does not reply to student's requests. I am just happy that i got through this course and never have to take a class with her again.

Dr. Karimi seems to be not that experienced in teaching. But I could tell that she is really caring to her students. In the last class she guided us go over some questions and they similarly occurred in our final. As long as you focus on what she is teaching, you will be fine though. Exams are fair. Assignments are kind of annoying but fine.
My mediocre midterm mark was replaced with a nice final mark! Prof needs to work on her lectures and notes, but clearly shows effort and willingness to improve, and is nice as a person.
her lectures are good sleeping aids

I have noticed all of her materials from lecture slides to practice exam questions are all taken from other websites. There is no effort being put into the materials at all. She also threw a project at us which we only had not even three days to complete when exams started. Oh yea, and you only get 90 minutes for a 3H finals. Gotta love SFU LOL.

The professor is extremely unclear when explaining important concepts. She does go through more examples in class but only after receiving feedback from students. Overall, she is just a terrible professor. Avoid at all costs!

By far the worst cmpt science prof at SFU. Barely can explain the material she is teaching in English. The difficulty of HW assignments have huge transition gaps. One assignment is easy and the next is absolutely hell. Well, we don't care about that shes teaching for first time because there are so many professors who still can do better than her.
its not possible to do the homework because you dont learn the material nor is it in any provided material. all this work and youll still be left wondering how and what to study for the final exam...
As the course progress, her lecture and slides become more and more over simplified and unclear to the point where you have to learn everything by yourself.
Assignments and notes copied from the internet/textbook. She does not teach how to solve any question.
Need to learn everything on your own. Any skills necessary for the assignments not taught in class.

It is very difficult to understand her lecture due to her bad public speaking skills. And her slides are filled with horrible wording that make the content very difficult to understand. Not recommended.

The professor definitely makes an effort and responds to emails quickly. However, the pacing of the course is somewhat inconsistent and the course is disorganized making it somewhat confusing to study for. The material isn't the hardest but it certainly becomes more of a challenge when the lecture slides occasionally seem fragmented. Be advised.
I appreciate profs who have good lecture notes, and she's one of them. I missed a few classes but studied the slides real good and did good on the midterm. She's available for extra help

This is likely second worst prof that I've had that ruined a typically medium difficulty course. Notes are bad, quizzes and exams questions are vague and will cost you time and marks. Would not recommend! However, would recommend taking CMPT354 next time it's offered if Ouldooz is teaching.

Some of the criticisms about criticisms on this page is really unfair. We pay just as much as any other section of 354, only to get a much lower quality learning experience (and grade). The notes are unclear and lack context, the assignments take too much time for what they're worth and don't help for exams, and the exam questions are unclear.

A lot of the criticism here are unfair. "Quiz is hard". The quiz averages are like 80%. Midterm 68%. She is a new lecturer, that is a clear. But she is CLEARLY trying her best, stays after lecture to answer questions and also provides bonus marks. I think in time she will be a great prof, she just needs to be given the time to prepare for the class

Quizzes are unclear. More time is spent trying to understand questions than answering it. Midterm covers material that has just been covered/is still being covered (optimization and parse trees). Repeats information many times but is unclear each time. Quiz once every two weeks. No one is able to get 100% on quiz. Class always ends early. Avoid.

Dr Karimi seriously cares about students' learning and understanding and goes over lecture materials if needed (haven't had many profs doing that in engineering school). Biweekly quizzes are a great way to stay on top of lecture materials (if you actually study for them!) Will definitely take other classes again with this prof in future.

Not hard midterm. I appreciate she does not want to fail all our us. The exam basically comes from her lecture slides, nothing more. Just the lecture itself is kind of tedious. You may want to learn by yourself.
Really not a good lecturer. Cannot explain things in a clear way. For most of the students they were stumped trying to figure out what she saying.

Still early in the semester. Lecture slides contain many minor typos (mostly spelling). Assignments are sometimes ambiguous. She fixes the mistakes/clarifies if a student asks. Anonymous feedback can be given any time. Considering that this is her first time teaching this course, I would say her material is excellent. Recommended.

Bad slides, decent tests/homeworks, and taught by one of the laziest professors in the CS department.
She's nice, but no feedback was given on a group project that took weeks to complete. Another one of those classes that makes you question what university is even good for. Happy to be done with this one, can't justifiably recommend this professor
Extremely easy class. Just read her slides and you'll get an A.

The course content is actually very interesting and useful. But the lectures were brutal. The assignments were great, and were fair but still challenging questions. There wasn't enough practice questions available for each of the chapters. The only way to material for the course was the lectures.
Just learn the material on your own. Her slides and approaches make it so difficult to understand. Examples are terribly chosen and make concepts more complex than they need to be.

She's nice, but the class unfortunately isn't structured well and gets complicated easily. Studying on your own is a lot easier, tests were pretty hard but not terrible. For such an important class, it's better to have a prof who can teach well and is engaged.

Dr. Evgenia is one of the most compassionate professors I've had at SFU. She genuinely cares about her students' wellbeing beyond just academics. She is very accessible outside of class, her quizzes and exams are very fair, she provides enough materials that prepare you well for exams.
Her lectures aren't the best, but her assignments and exams are extremely fair.
not the best lecturer, but she gives very fair exams. One of the easier 300 level classes.

lectures are garbage and video lectures don't help at all (just her reading off the slides, no explanations). SO BORING THAT I WANTED TO DESTROY MY COMPUTER ATLEAST 3 TIMES / LECTURE. Concepts are too theoretical sometimes and impractical as hell.

HORRIBLE!. This course seriously made me want to drop out of CS and switch to a different major due to three reasons: 1) What we learnt is useless in the industry. Period. 2) She made it 20 times harder to learn the material due to poor explanations and lecture notes. 3) It was so boring I wanted to claw my eyes out.

You would find her reading from slides and her accent makes it difficult to understand her. Further, she comes off as detached and her midterm and final were tougher to score. As compared to other professors in the course, she taught more concepts that weren't required.
She's not the best, but the course is easy so take it if you want.
Avoid like the plague

She cannot teach for the life of her. This was fine because finally I did not feel guilty when skipping her lectures and learning on my own as this course is easy enough to make that very doable. God bless indian youtubers. She cares about the students and responds fast on piazza. Her assignments are more difficult than exams.

Plagiarized lecture content and halfway through the course pretty much had a single TA teaching the class after she got into an accident. She was MIA after that, I don't know why she could not have provided support through zoom/remotely instead of letting TAs handle the course for her.
Arrvindh 2.0

As much as it pains me to give this rating, because I don't think shes a bad teacher, this class has been abysmal since the midway point. Through no fault of her own, she has not been in class. However, this has greatly decreased the quality of the course. Rubrics are unclear, marked materials are not returned, and the TA's do not care. Avoid 354

She has no idea what she's talking about. She leaves the marking to the TA's, who also have no idea what's going on. Rips her slides straight off of free online courses and regurgitates it like a mother bird. Can't answer questions about the material. Assignments are not good practice and take too long. Absolutely atrocious teaching style.

One of the best profs for CMPT 354. She is very good at explaining concepts, and approachable in office hours. Very understand and caring for students' well being. Tests aren't too difficult if you do practice problems.

Midterm 2 testing materials are the same as final exam, and yet still gives us one final project to do, which not only testing you on database knowledge, but also focused on your programming skills. sorry what class is this again?

I should have listened, and avoided her. Did not do that. I now see that everything written about her is correct. Most if not all of the course material she uses is ripped off a professor in the UK, including her assignments and homework. She barely responds to emails. Barely provides additional practice questions, says no outright when asked.
She's not a prof, she never answer your question directly and the only answer you will get is "read the notes". For the email, she needs 2 months to reply. Cheers
She never replies to emails, doesn't know how to teach, always confuses herself in the middle of the lectures.
The worst professor ever. never ever take with her

AVOID AT ALL COST. this prof does not answer any type of questions in related to the assignment, midterm or finals, in person and on piazza. lectures were basically reading from the slides, which have flaws that were never fixed. the whole experience was just confusing and painful because "it's up to you to figure it out".

I have no idea how she is employed at SFU. Refuses to answer simple questions about midterms and finals. Extremely confusing lectures. Cancelled over a week of class. Discourages discussions on Piazza. From what I can tell from talking to classmates, majority of the class seemed to struggle due to her poor teaching ability. DO NOT take with her.

This prof did not what does this course cover, she won't answer any academic question because she does not understand at all. She does not care about the class so she will find every single excuse to cancel a class and will not show up during exams even final. The TAs are exactly same as her, useless and barely hold office hour.

Class average was C+. Final was brutal. I felt like I tried so hard to get a C+. Barely explained anything in class. Even explaining makes everything more confused. Didn't properly teach SQL in class and gave advanced queries in Labs. 99% of my work is self-learning. This is the worst course I had ever taken.

Questions on class discussion-board are useless; she considers any sort of discussion on course material cheating. She is incredibly unresponsive to emails/discussion posts; never gave any information regarding midterm/final. Questions in lectures are pointless; she gets extremely defensive and behaves like questions are challenges to her teaching.

All of her lectures are her reading directly from the slides, so you'll be just fine skipping those, except for around once a week when she goes over some practice exercise solutions that are usually posted online. She does not have office hours and is unavailable on the online message boards 1-2 days before an exam or assignment deadline.

She can't explain things well and cancel class multiple times. Because of bad slides and less SQL practice, it was very hard to do the lab (writing queries). I studied this course by reading books and online resources on my own. The instructor and lecture are not very helpful. Avoid her if possible. Also, that comment below is definitely sarcasm...

She can't explain very well, I think half of class can't follow her(she is friendly and willing to help). However, the midterm, final and assignment are not hard. She spend too much time on math rather than SQL. Didn't learn too much, the grade is ok, avoid her if you wanna learn something.

unorganised lectures, slides are not that helpful. Really bad at explaining concepts and practice solutions. So lazy that she just copy the questions from the midterms and put them in the final. Include materials from 454 and included that in the final and not explaining the materials properly. Avoid her if you can!

Includes all information in lecture slides which really helps to offset the fact that she can't teach well. I had much greater success tuning her out and just reading the notes rather than listening to her struggle to explain concepts. Overall fair assignments/tests with the final being a little harsh.

Jim's lectures in general are pretty chill and exams are straightforward as long as you do all the assignments. He might not  be  the best person you would want to ask for  help right after class since he usually wants to leave and go back to his office probably. But when I had questions and emailed him, he always replied me within the same day.
Not clear!. He may be good for research and MAY know his material but not at getting in front of a class to explain it properly.

Quite weak prof. He just rambles off his slides, and his explanations are very weak (if he has any). Good luck trying to ask for more help if you don't understand what he is trying to say. I would stay away from his classes. If you happen to fall behind, the book and friends are the only one who can help. Exams were not very straight forward either
Jim doesn't know the material all that well and was not willing to help with clarifying on the assignments. The course itself is very useful however.

His lectures were straightforward and his lecture notes were clear. However, understanding the examples given in the lectures was far not enought for doing the assignments. I used lots of online supplementary materials to understand this course and do the assignments. This was time consuming but self-study is one of the most important skills for us

Professor Jack Thomas is one of the best CMPT prof's I've had at SFU. His lectures covered a significant amount of information without it feeling overwhelming and his midterm and final were all fair without having to invest significant time into the material. His assignments are a mix between being easy if you know the material and a lot of work.

Good lecturer, reasonable pace, and fair assignments + exams. Databases are important and this class was a really good introduction to them. One thing you have to watch out for is that this class is pretty easy, so the average marks are quite high ( low 80's to high 70's) so he scales down the class. Stay on top of everything to get a good mark.
The class average was near 90% ?!!!  He scaled down the class really hard. If you just want to pass this course, take it with him. Otherwise, avoid him.

I understood his lectures, but couldn't really get into them. Sparse, not very useful powerpoints. Had to do some reading in the textbook to really get it. It's overall a pretty easy class. Should have put in more effort, but there was no fear to motivate me. If you have to take 354 with him, don't worry, but try to get someone else if you can.

Great Prof!! Highly recommend taking CMPT 354 with him!  His lecture slides are crystal clear, he does an excellent job of explaining concepts, lots of examples, etc.  He had a great marking scheme; if you do better on the final then the midterm (no matter what the marks are), the final will replace the midterm mark!  So impressed!!

This guy is really funny, his actions are just funny. The assignments were long but not too hard. His midterm was okay, but the final.... EKKK yeah not so easy after all.. Overall, the course is interesting.

the whole class was getting B+, and I was getting an A before the final. but i was so disappointed he made the final like 70% harder than other midterms... but good thing is, his lectures are clear, organized with slides, funny, love to let u participate and a good prof. the best of it is you somehow you feel ur learning instead of feeling sleepy.

Great, helpful, funny and accommodating prof! Print out slides and take notes in class, they'll help later. Allows cheat sheets on exams. Assignments are long but you learn a lot and doing them will basically prep your the midterm. Take it with him if you can; I certainly learned a lot + it's easy so far!

A good guy, very willing to help. But if you really want to learn something, you need to do a lot by yourself. His lectures are too straight forward. FYI 31/85 students got more than 90% on MT. assignments are long but not hard. If Database not your concentration go with him you will be fine with your grade. While if not, consider about it.

Good prof who cares. Material wasn't always the most sparkling stuff but he attempts to make lectures interesting. As already mentioned, his assignments are long but really ingrain the material. Grading was fair. Final exam was about right, no surprises.

Great professor, is very willing to help in office hrs. Exams are fair and so are assignments. They're tedious but helpful in learning the material. He allowed cheat sheets for the midterm/final! Really good professor, attend the lectures you'll learn more that way than from the book. Actually cares about his students, its refreshing to see.

This got to be a joke of a prof. He always "doesn't want to give too much detail on the assignments' requirements", yet expects you to guess the right solution. Granted the TA for this course is a total failure, but the prof doesn't make the situation any better. Tests are unfair since he likes to test on things that has "no solution". Avoid!
THE WORST PROF EVER
No Comments
Very nice guy. Tries hard to make the lectures clear and easy to follow. The assignments really help with the exams. The exams covered stuff from the book that wasnt in the lectures - watch out.

He's a sincerely nice guy who will help out tremendously in office hours... However, his tests seem stupid, he seems to test the unimportant things.  That said, his course is pretty easy, just don't expect to learn any of the material in depth.

Start assignments early as they are much more difficult than the examples provided in the slides. John provides pretty good lectures and the best part of the class was how responsive he is on Canvas. Exams are pretty fair, just make sure to read instructions carefully as they are similar to assignments, but there is a twist that can throw you off.

Thought this was going to be an easier given CMPT 225 reviews, but it seemed like a completely different prof. Decent guy, but as a prof he just reads off slides for the most part. This class requires a decent amount of review and the final had more NOSQL than expected. I couldn't take advantage of office hours, but seems available.

John was a decent prof, although the lectures did get quite boring at times. The weekly quizzes were basically free marks since they were open book. The assignments were doable. The midterm was not too hard but the final was very challenging. To John's credit, he was very accessible on Canvas discussion boards.

Do NOT take his course. Weekly quizzes were brutal. I don't know if I really learned something in his class. Had spent so much time to review all his lectures, to practice everything he gave, plus some online practice, to ask questions in office hour... It turned out assignments, quizzes, exam, project grades were jokes to you.

Perfectly paced lectures that are easy to follow and give a good understanding of the material. Four assignments are fun and reasonable, and the project was enjoyable with a month to do it. Weekly quizzes were annoying, they started off very difficult but he listened to requests to ease the difficulty and gave more time. I would recommend him.

Lecturer were super boring. Final was oddly difficult with some weird questions like query customer lastName "Trump" or Trigger a data attack on competitor. If you study hard, problem solve all the time, but you feel like your work still cannot be valued.

Barely passed this class. Everyone in the other section had a blast doing this course while Edgar made it impossible to actually have fun. Way to many assignments . I highly recommend to not take any classes with Edgar. Save ur self the pain.

Lectures are quite boring and it just feels like he hates teaching. Does not explain material very well and doesn't answer questions clearly. Only took this class because of how difficult it is to get enrolled. Would recommend choosing a different prof if you had a choice.
His lecture presentation is terrible and it made you feel like you had a astriction

He is good at explaining things and his notes are crystal clear and covers everything you need (you don't even need to come to class as long as you read his slides). However the assignments and midterm are quite tricky and he gives quite a lot of assignments compared to other profs.
A easy and useful course in CS.
His slide are f**king good, and he is the best teacher around!!! Top funny guy in SFU ~
His slide are crazie good, and he is the best teacheer around.......!!!!!!!!!!!!!

He dishes out far too much work that takes forever to complete. His classes are boring. He is constantly going off topic witterng about stuff that's happening in his life.I found him pompous. He never gave a straight answer to a question. Hated the class.
His homework is hard and takes forever to do, and very little people get full marks on them. The tests are fair
Gotta love that A-
Meh. He was alright as a prof.  Must like droll British humour! Class was a little dry.
No Comments
Reading straight from the lecture notes was very interesting.  :P
No Comments
very unclear during lectures and jokes are not funny.
Knows his stuff, funny, approachable. Makes lectures interesting.
No Comments
Good teacher and he is very approachable and helpful to his students
SFU shud hire more prof like John.  He knows his DB and can teach!
Very humorous, and knowledgeable prof.
No Comments
Very good notes.  If evening class lectures become painfully long and boring. :)
Just read the book, he's British
No Comments
Good prof, best exam marking time ever!
